Detailed Description

An annotation positions a content layer relative to some anchor point.

Annotations can be used to add text or images that are anchored to a feature of a graph. For example, the graph title is an annotation anchored to the plot area frame.

Member Function Documentation

void CPTAnnotation(AbstractMethods)::positionContentLayer ( ) [virtual]

Positions the content layer relative to its reference anchor.

This method must be overridden by subclasses. The default implementation does nothing.
